ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Emulating and virtualizing Windows x64 user-mode executables within a controlled environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Hypervisor-based emulation of Windows x64 user-mode executables â€¢ Uses Windows Hypervisor Platform (WHP) API â€¢ Clones address space of a suspended process into the virtual environment â€¢ Forwards syscalls to the host OS
ðŸ“– Summary: WinVisor is a hypervisor-based emulator for Windows x64 user-mode executables, leveraging the Windows Hypervisor Platform API. It creates a virtual environment by cloning the address space of a suspended process, allowing for the execution and monitoring of applications in a virtualized setting. The emulator forwards syscalls to the host OS and provides a framework for implementing custom syscall hooks.
